column4: make that ssh -l peirce141 191.168.0.100  - the login name must come first
do you have itpables - 'iptables -L INPUT'
you need to 'iptables -I INPUT 3  -p tcp --dport ssh -j ACCEPT"
alright, ill try that
still nothing
paste the new iptalbes -L
that's 'iptables -L'  past that
does your router port forward port 22?
i don't believe so
if you're trying to connect from outside then you need to port forward through it
only from local boxes
ok
you need to tell iptables what to accept that port  sudo iptables -I INPUT 1 -p tcp --dport 22 -j ACCEPT
i'll try, one sec
thanks a bunch for that, it's perfect now
now you need to find the rule file loaded at boot  - and do a iptables-save (that file name)
how would i go about finding the rule file?
I'm trying to find it on my system
alright, thanks
I have it loaded at wlan startup time -  with iptables-restore /home/root/itables.rules
is there an easy way to find where my iptables rules are? I dont have any similar file on my system
neither do I but the ones I put there.  so  do 'sudo iptabes-save /etc/iptables.up.rules'
and when you wanto to invoke the rules when you reboot  'sudo iptables-restore /etc/iptables.up.rules'
